DOC.HEADLINE: CHINA-TAIWAN PACT DEALS WITH HIJACKINGS
DOC.TEXT: A breakthrough agreement between longtime enemies on mainland_China and Taiwan includes important steps meant to stop a spate of hijackings from China . It was the first significant agreement since formal contact between the two rival governments began in the spring of 1993 . The latest talks ended Sunday , and the highest-ranking Chinese envoy to visit Taiwan since 1949 , Tang Shubei , flew back to Beijing on Monday . The two sides reached consensus on how to deal with hijackers , as well as illegal mainland workers in Taiwan and fishing disputes in the Taiwan Straits , a joint news release said . A formal agreement will be signed after minor differences are resolved , it said .
